author: mklement0
body:
`Write-Error -Exception` should allow you to report a custom error (by writing a custom `ErrorRecord` instance to the error stream) that wraps the given `System.Exception`[-derived] instance.

Currently, this appears to be broken, at least inside a `catch` block, where `Write-Error -Exception $_.Exception ...` unexpectedly seems to have the same effect as calling `Write-Error -ErrorRecord $_`, i.e. passing the PowerShell-supplied `ErrorRecord` instance _through_, while ignoring additional parameters such as `-Category` and `-ErrorId`.

By contrast, `Write-Error -Message ....` _is_ effective in creating a custom `ErrorRecord` with a custom category, error ID, ..., and, curiously, specifying the original error's _inner_ exception (if present) seems to work too (`Write-Error -Exception $_.Exception.InnerException ...`)

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# With $_.Exception.*InnerException*, it works.
& { try { [int]::Parse('no') } catch { Write-Error -Exception $_.Exception.InnerException -ErrorId CustomErr 2>$null; $Error[0].FullyQualifiedErrorId } } | 
  Should -Be CustomErr

# !! With just $_.Exception, it doesn't.
& { try { [int]::Parse('no') } catch { Write-Error -Exception $_.Exception -ErrorId CustomErr 2>$null; $Error[0].FullyQualifiedErrorId } } | 
  Should -Be CustomError
```

# Expected behavior

Both tests should succeed.

# Actual behavior

The second test fails, because the resulting error record doesn't have the custom error ID:

```none
Expected strings to be the same, but they were different.
Expected length: 11
Actual length:   15
Strings differ at index 0.
Expected: 'CustomError'
But was:  'FormatException'
```

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-preview.4
```
title: Write-Error -Exception is broken: doesn't create custom error record
